Congratulations 2016 Phage Hunters! Here's your first one! @UMBCBiology @UMBC #SEAPHAGES @phagesdb @UMBCCNMS

citation.abstract: Three double-stranded DNA phi29-like Bacillus cereus group bacteriophages, BeachBum, Harambe, and SerPounce, were identified and characterized. BeachBum and Harambe are closely related but are remarkably different from previously identified phi29-like phages. SerPounce is substantially closer to other phi29-like phages, enabling the identification of its prohead RNA (pRNA) gene.
authors: on behalf of the 2016 UMBC Phage Hunters
citation.title:
Complete Genome Sequences of Three phi29-Like
            Bacillus cereus
            Group
            Podoviridae

author.name: UMBC Phage Hunters
